results.title: Colleges of Advanced Education
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Smith and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: Colleges of Advanced Education offer a practical alternative to University training in a number of technical and creative fields. This film examines the wide range of studies being undertaken in Colleges of Advanced Education, all over Australia.

results.title: College
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton Productions, Joseph Schenck, Buster Keaton and James W. Horne
results.brief_description: Buster goes to college and becomes sports obsessed when his lady love considers him less than manly. Spending a fortune on every imaginable piece of sporting apparatus, Buster is determined to muscle his way into her affections. This film is representative of Keatons madcap antics and incredible stunts with a grand comic finale which will leave the audience reeling.

results.title: Collectors
results.brief_description: An inventive and funny documentary that looks at various types of collections. Reg collects spark plugs and Margot collects frogs. Even more interesting are the collectors. There is a thriving sub-culture of ‘object hunters’ out there, attending swap meets and fetes in search of that ‘ gem ‘. Some say it’s all in the chase while others prefer the find!

results.title: Collectors
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Luigi Acquisto, Chris McGill and Diana Leach
results.brief_description: An inventive and funny documentary that looks at various types of collections: snow domes, frogs, spark plugs, etc. Even more interesting are the collectors themselves who are forever in search of that ‘gem’.

results.title: Collection and preservation of evidence. Section I and II
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description: Instructional film portrays homicide investigation, including equipment necessary for the collection and preservation of evidence; examining details of collecting, marking, and preserving all evidence; photographic recording or sketching of the scene of the crime; evaluation of the evidence; questioning of suspects; and solution of the crime.

results.title: Collected stories of the XPT
results.creator_credit: Banksia Productions, Cathy Beitz and Kath McIntryre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great train journeys of Australia”.
On the Express Passenger Train, experience the fastest form of land transport between Australia’s two major capital cities, Melbourne and Sydney. Reaching speeds up to 70 miles per hour, the XPT travels across rolling plains and through the country’s Great Dividing Range. See rural areas rich with the history of early settlers who continued the struggles they imported from England and Ireland, including the outlaw, Ned Kelly. Visit the border town of Albury and find out about Australia’s unique railroad history. The town of Goulburn, home to the largest jail in the Southern Hemisphere, offers an insight into modern Aboriginal history. The view out the window of this train reveals a hundred fascinating observations about Australia and it’s people.

results.title: Collars and cuffs
results.brief_description: A slapstick silent comedy about the high jinx that occurs at the Rough and Wet Laundry between the laundry clerk and his boss as they struggle to complete their tasks on time. The story ends with disastrous results as the washing tub overflows with hot, soapy water - spilling on to the streets and wreaking havoc. Featuring Stan Laurel, Mark Jones, Eddie Baker, Katherine Grant.

results.title: Collaborator
results.brief_description:
Collaborator presents a unique opportunity for teachers and students of theatre to explore issues, processes and the personnel associated with the creation of a new piece of Australian Theatre. This CD ROM provides insight into the creation of Arena Theatre Compnay’s PANACEA through interviews, formal and informal, with the artists involved and footage of the production in both rehearsal and in performance.

Peter Robert, Head of Drama, Yarra Valley Grammar School

results.title: Colin Thiele
results.creator_credit: Australia Council, AFI [au] and Peter Campbell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Author, poet and biographer, Colin Thiele recalls his childhood in the German migrant community north of the Barossa Valley and his early love of literature. Thiele remembers his student days and his association with movements such as the Angry Penguins. He also discusses the effect on his life and work of his long battle with rheumatoid arthritis and reads a poem about the isolation of pain.
